claim: Exactly seven posts on the Codebase Community have been viewed more than 35,000 times and have received no comments from other users.
extra_info: have been viewed over 35000 times refers to ViewCount > 35000; received no comments refers to CommentCount = 0;
reasoning: The query SELECT COUNT(*) FROM posts WHERE ViewCount > 35000 AND CommentCount = 0 returns exactly 7, which matches the claim that exactly seven posts have been viewed more than 35,000 times and received no comments.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by examining the database schema and then querying for the relevant data.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The `posts` table has both `ViewCount` and `CommentCount` columns. Now let me query for posts with ViewCount > 35000 and CommentCount = 0.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM posts WHERE ViewCount > 35000 AND CommentCount = 0;"
input.description: Count posts with ViewCount > 35000 and CommentCount = 0

content.text:
The query returns exactly 7 posts that have been viewed more than 35,000 times and have received no comments. This matches the claim precisely.
